org.tinylog.provider

Interface LoggingProvider


  • public interface LoggingProvider
    API for providing log entries to a concrete logging framework implementation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ContextProvider getContextProvider()
      Returns the corresponding context provider.
      Level getMinimumLevel(String tag)
      Gets the lowest activated severity level for a tag.
      boolean isEnabled(int depth, String tag, Level level)
      Checks whether log entries with given tag and severity level will be output.
      void log(int depth, String tag, Level level, Throwable exception, Object obj, Object... arguments)
      Provides a regular log entry.
      void shutdown()
      Shuts down the logging provider and frees all allocated resources.

    • Method Detail

      • getContextProvider

        ContextProvider getContextProvider()
        Returns the corresponding context provider.
        Returns:
        Corresponding context provider

      • getMinimumLevel

        Level getMinimumLevel(String tag)
        Gets the lowest activated severity level for a tag.

        The result of this method is cacheable and can be used to stop processing log entries at an early stage, before doing any expensive operations. All lower severity levels than the returned level will be never output. But it is not guaranteed the returned severity level or higher will be really output (for example if output depends on package or class name).

        Parameters:
        tag - Tag to check (can be null)
        Returns:
        Lowest activated severity level

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled(int depth,
                  String tag,
                  Level level)
        Checks whether log entries with given tag and severity level will be output.
        Parameters:
        depth - Depth of caller in stack trace (e.g. '1' if there is only one method between caller and this method in the stack trace)
        tag - Tag to check (can be null)
        level - Severity level to check
        Returns:
        true if given severity level is enabled, false if disabled

      • log

        void log(int depth,
         String tag,
         Level level,
         Throwable exception,
         Object obj,
         Object... arguments)
        Provides a regular log entry.
        Parameters:
        depth - Depth of caller in stack trace (e.g. '1' if there is only one method between caller and this method in the stack trace)
        tag - Tag of log entry or null if untagged
        level - Severity level of log entry
        exception - Exception to log or null
        obj - Message to log or null
        arguments - Arguments for message or null

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shuts down the logging provider and frees all allocated resources. This method should be called only if auto shutdown is explicitly disabled.
